Note that this loop is closed, and it consists of 4 line curves. We have completed the 2D sketch for this part. We will now move on to scaling the sketch, transforming it into a 3D sketch, and extruding it to generate the 3D model. First, scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.75, using the scaling parameter sketch_scale. Now, create a transformation based on the coordinate system's Euler angles (set to [0.0, 0.0, 0.0]) and translation vector (set to [0.0, 0.0, 0.0]) to transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch. Finally, extrude the 3D sketch along the normal by 0.0019 units and along the opposite direction of the normal by 0.0 units to create the 3D prism model. The resulting intermediate part has dimensions of approximately 0.75 units by 1.125 units by 4 units.</description>
